'''Gothita''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ゴチム''' ''Gothimu'') is a {{type|Psychic}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Gothorita}} starting at [[level]] 32, which evolves into {{p|Gothitelle}} starting at level 41.

==Biology==
Gothita is a small, humanoid Pokémon. A small tuft of hair sticks up from the top of its head, and it has two white, bow-shaped feelers on each side of its purple head, and a third bow-shaped feeler on its neck. These ribbon-like feelers are used to amplify its psychic power. It has two large blue eyes with three eyelashes on each and small red lips. Gothita intently observes those around it, and can become unaware of attacks. Its torso is black with a white zigzagging line running horizontally through the middle. Its arms and legs are short and stubby with no visible digits.

==In the anime==
[[File:Nini Gothita.png|thumb|left|250px|Gothita in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Gothita debuted in ''[[BW035|Where Did You Go, Audino?]]'', under the ownership of [[Christie]].

A Gothita appeared in [[PK22]] alongside {{p|Drilbur}} and {{p|Darumaka}}, when it was angry at {{AP|Oshawott}} and {{AP|Tepig}}, who had eaten the apples that the three had collected.

A Gothita appeared in ''[[BW055|Scraggy and the Demanding Gothita!]]'', under the ownership of [[Katharine]]. Katharine's Gothita was shown to have developed a crush on {{AP|Scraggy}} and hoped it would join Katharine's team. However, {{AP|Snivy}} defeated it in a battle, making it retreat.

A Gothita appeared in ''[[PK25|Eevee & Friends]]'' alongside {{p|Gothorita}} and {{p|Gothitelle}}, where they were friends with an {{p|Umbreon}} living with an {{p|Eevee}} and the rest of the [[Eeveelution]]s.

A Gothita appeared in ''[[PK27|Pikachu and the Pokémon Music Squad]]''.

A Gothita appeared in ''[[XY101|A Dancing Debut!]]'', under the ownership of [[Nini]].

===Minor appearances===
A Gothita appeared in ''[[BW051|Lost at the Stamp Rally!]]'', where it was seen performing in a [[Pokémon Musical]] show.

Multiple Gothita appeared in ''[[BW053|A Maractus Musical!]]''.

A Gothita made a cameo appearance in ''[[BW069|Climbing the Tower of Success!]]''.

A Gothita made a cameo appearance in ''[[BW085|All for the Love of Meloetta!]]''.

A Gothita appeared in ''[[BW103|Curtain Up, Unova League!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Gothita appeared in ''[[BW125|Cilan and the Case of the Purrloin Witness!]]''.

{{an|Shauna}} was revealed to own a Gothita in ''[[XY039|Summer of Discovery!]]''.

A Gothita appeared in ''[[XY040|Day Three Blockbusters!]]''.

A Trainer's Gothita appeared in ''[[XY138|The First Day of the Rest of Your Life!]]''.

A Trainer's Gothita appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]''.

===In the [[Pokémon Adventures]] manga===
A Trainer's Gothita appeared in ''[[PS474|Defeating Stoutland]]''.

A Gothita appeared in ''[[PS483|Special Delivery]]'' as one of the Pokémon competing in {{ci|Nimbasa}}'s [[Pokémon Musical]].

A Gothita was among several Pokémon attracted to [[Alder]]'s wrestling match with his {{p|Bouffalant}} in [[Nimbasa City]] in ''[[PS487|A New Perspective]]''.

A Gothita appeared in ''[[PAXY28|Scizor Defends]]'' as a Pokémon in the [[Pokémon Village]].

==Trivia==
*Gothita and {{p|Solosis}}'s evolution branch can be considered parallel. Both are [[Generation V]] Pokémon evolving once at level 32 then at level 41. Solosis' family branch can only be found in Pokémon White and Pokémon White 2, while Gothita can only be found in Pokémon Black and Pokémon Black 2. They are both Psychic-type Pokémon with similar base experience and catch rates, they gain new moves at similar levels, and they have base stat totals of 290.

===Origin===
Gothita is based on a child dressed in {{wp|Lolita fashion#Gothic Lolita|Gothic lolita}} fashion.

====Name origin====
Gothita may be a combination of ''{{wp|Goth subculture|gothic}}'' and ''lolita''.

Gothimu may be a combination of ''gothic'' and 予知夢 ''yochimu'' (precognitive dream) or 見る ''miru'' (to observe).
